trans-unit.source: How to: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This How To describes how to configure Facebook as an identity provider using <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This How To describes how to configure Facebook as an identity provider using <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Facebook as an identity provider for your ASP.NET web application will allow your users to authenticate to your ASP.NET web application by logging on to their Facebook account.
trans-unit.target: Configuring Facebook as an identity provider for your ASP.NET web application will allow your users to authenticate to your ASP.NET web application by logging on to their Facebook account.

trans-unit.source: Contents
trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Summary of steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Configure a namespace to be used with Facebook as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Configure a namespace to be used with Facebook as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Configure trust and token transformation rules.
trans-unit.target: Configure trust and token transformation rules.

trans-unit.source: Become familiar with the endpoint reference, list of services, and metadata endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Become familiar with the endpoint reference, list of services, and metadata endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Configuring Facebook as an identity provider eliminates the need to create and manage the authentication and identity management mechanism.
trans-unit.target: Configuring Facebook as an identity provider eliminates the need to create and manage the authentication and identity management mechanism.

trans-unit.source: A familiar authentication procedure helps the end user.
trans-unit.target: A familiar authentication procedure helps the end user.

trans-unit.source: Using <token>secondref_acs</token>, it is easy to set up a configuration that allows your application to use Facebook authentication.
trans-unit.target: Using <token>secondref_acs</token>, it is easy to set up a configuration that allows your application to use Facebook authentication.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to accomplish this task.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to accomplish this task.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration depicts the overall flow of configuring a relying party for <token>secondref_acs</token> use.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration depicts the overall flow of configuring a relying party for <token>secondref_acs</token> use.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Get a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret

trans-unit.source: This step gets a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret.
trans-unit.target: This step gets a Facebook Application ID and a Facebook Application Secret.

trans-unit.source: These are required to configure Facebook as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: These are required to configure Facebook as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: To get a Facebook Application ID and Facebook Application Secret
trans-unit.target: To get a Facebook Application ID and Facebook Application Secret

trans-unit.source: Create a Facebook account at http://facebook.com.
trans-unit.target: Create a Facebook account at http://facebook.com.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to http://www.facebook.com/developers/.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to http://www.facebook.com/developers/.

trans-unit.source: On the Facebook Developers page, click <ui>Create New App</ui> and then follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: On the Facebook Developers page, click <ui>Create New App</ui> and then follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: On the main page for your application, copy the values of the <ui>App ID</ui> and <ui>App Secret</ui> fields.
trans-unit.target: On the main page for your application, copy the values of the <ui>App ID</ui> and <ui>App Secret</ui> fields.

trans-unit.source: You will use these when you configure Facebook as an identity provider on the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal in the next step.
trans-unit.target: You will use these when you configure Facebook as an identity provider on the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal in the next step.

trans-unit.source: In the Site URL field, specify the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) URL of your namespace, including the leading HTTPS://, for example, https://my-ns1.accesscontrol.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: In the Site URL field, specify the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) URL of your namespace, including the leading HTTPS://, for example, https://my-ns1.accesscontrol.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: Your namespace will be different.
trans-unit.target: Your namespace will be different.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: In this step you will specify Facebook as an identity provider using information that you got in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: In this step you will specify Facebook as an identity provider using information that you got in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: To configure Facebook as an identity provider
trans-unit.target: To configure Facebook as an identity provider

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> portal, click <ui>Identity Providers</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> portal, click <ui>Identity Providers</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Facebook Application</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Facebook Application</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Facebook Application</ui> page, specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Facebook Application</ui> page, specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Display name</ui>: Enter any name.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Display name</ui>: Enter any name.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Application ID</ui>: Enter the value of the <system>App ID</system> field on the Facebook page.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Application ID</ui>: Enter the value of the <system>App ID</system> field on the Facebook page.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Application Secret</ui>: Enter the value of the <system>App Secret</system> field on the Facebook page.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Application Secret</ui>: Enter the value of the <system>App Secret</system> field on the Facebook page.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Application Permissions</ui>: Enter <system>email</system>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Application Permissions</ui>: Enter <system>email</system>.

trans-unit.source: Review additional permissions you might need at http://developers.facebook.com/docs/authentication/permissions.
trans-unit.target: Review additional permissions you might need at http://developers.facebook.com/docs/authentication/permissions.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Login link text</ui>: Enter <system>Facebook</system>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Login link text</ui>: Enter <system>Facebook</system>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Image URL</ui>—Optionally, you can specify the image URL.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Image URL</ui>—Optionally, you can specify the image URL.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Relying party applications</ui>: Select the relying party applications that will use Facebook for authentication.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Relying party applications</ui>: Select the relying party applications that will use Facebook for authentication.
